Description: Fragment of a cylindrical box or handle in bone; the body has ribbed surface, probably produced on a lathe; the lower portion is indented for a lid or for attachment to another part piece; made from the metatarsal of a bovoid.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Curium
Curator's comments: Material identified by François Popin in April 2007. See SCE IV/1D, pp. 549-556 for ivory objects of LBA date
Bibliographic references: Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p. 80, Tomb 89 no. 9)
